questions.clue: This creature, known for its fiery breath, is commonly depicted as a large, scaly reptile in European folklore.
In Greek mythology, this creature has the head of a bull and the body of a man, and was housed in the Labyrinth by King Minos.
This legendary bird from Arabian mythology is said to regenerate or be reborn from its own ashes.
Originating from Mesopotamian mythology, this part-lion, part-eagle creature is often depicted as a guardian of palaces.
This water-dwelling creature from Scottish folklore is said to appear as a horse and lure humans to a watery grave.
This invention by Johannes Gutenberg in the mid-15th century revolutionized the way books were produced.
Leonardo da Vinci sketched designs for this flying machine, resembling a modern helicopter.
In 1593, Galileo Galilei invented this instrument for measuring temperature.
This Renaissance innovation by Niccolò Tartaglia and others helped improve the accuracy of cannon fire.
Andreas Vesalius published this influential book in 1543, transforming the study of human anatomy.
This popular Mexican street food is a folded tortilla filled with meat, cheese, and other toppings.
In Thailand, this noodle dish often served with shrimp or chicken is known for its salty, sweet, and sour flavors.
Originating from the Middle East, this deep-fried ball made of chickpeas or fava beans is often served in pita bread.
In India, this savory street food snack consists of a hollow, crispy shell filled with a spicy mixture of water, tamarind, and chickpeas.
A favorite in Japan, this octopus-filled snack is cooked in a special molded pan and topped with mayonnaise and bonito flakes.

categories.name: Classic Novels by Their First Lines

questions.clue: It was the best of times, it was the worst of times.
questions.answer: What is A Tale of Two Cities?

questions.clue: Call me Ishmael.
It is a truth universally acknowledged, that a single man in possession of a good fortune, must be in want of a wife.
All happy families are alike; each unhappy family is unhappy in its own way.
In a hole in the ground there lived a hobbit.
This scale, ranging from EF0 to EF5, is used to rate the intensity of tornadoes.
These rapid, downward blasts of air during a thunderstorm can cause damage similar to a tornado.
This type of cloud, often associated with thunderstorms, has an anvil-shaped top.
The meteorological phenomenon where warm air is trapped under a layer of cold air is known as this.
This phenomenon, characterized by bands of high-altitude, fast-moving air, can influence weather patterns and flight paths.

final.clue: This world capital, whose name translates to 'Eastern Capital', is located on a bay named for its country.
